description: A quick and delicious South Indian breakfast dish made with semolina, spices, and vegetables.
ingredients: [{"name": "semolina (rava / sooji)", "units": "cup", "amount": 1}, {"name": "oil", "units": "tbsp", "amount": 1.5}, {"name": "mustard seeds (rai / sarson)", "units": "tsp", "amount": 0.5}, {"name": "urad dal (split black lentils)", "units": "tsp", "amount": 1}, {"name": "curry leaves (kadi patta)", "units": "pieces", "amount": 4}, {"name": "slit green chilli", "units": "pieces", "amount": 2}, {"name": "finely chopped onion", "units": "cup", "amount": 0.25}, {"name": "salt", "units": "to taste", "amount": null}, {"name": "lemon juice", "units": "tsp", "amount": 2}, {"name": "sugar", "units": "tsp", "amount": 2}, {"name": "finely chopped coriander (dhania)", "units": "tbsp", "amount": 1}]
instructions: To make upma, heat the semolina in a kadhai and dry roast on a medium flame for 4 to 5 minutes, while stirring occasionally. Keep aside. Heat the oil in a kadhai and add the mustard seeds. When the seeds crackle, add the urad dal, curry leaves and green chillies and sauté on a medium flame for a few seconds. Add the onions and sauté on a medium flame for 1 to 2 minutes. Add the roasted semolina, 3 cups of hot water and salt and mix well and cover with a lid and cook on a slow flame for 3 to 4 minutes, while stirring occasionally. Add the lemon juice and sugar, mix well and cook on a medium flame for another 1 minute, while stirring continuously. Fill the upma in a glass bowl and demould on a plate. Serve the upma immediately garnished with coriander.
notes: Feel free to add vegetables like carrots, peas, or potatoes for added nutrition. Serve with coconut chutney or sambhar.
